Package net.codemusic.smartears

Interface Summary
IAnswer This interface represents an answer that can be played and which the user must identify or otherwise answer
IAnswerManager This interface is responsible for managing a user-alterable set of answers.
IAnswerSelectionStrategy This interface represents a class that is a particular way of choosing the next answer from a set of possible answers.
IController This is the interface that is used to provide access to the main objects in the system and to connect the GUI classes to the classes that model the sysetm.
IExampleManager The IExampleManager is responsible for controlling the example related operations of the system
IExcercise This interface represents a collection of IAnswers that constitute a set of related structures to be learned together
IExcerciseManager This interface is responsible for handling excercise level events for this system, such as changing to a different excercise
IRangeManager This interface manages the set of pitch boundaries that keep the sounds played within a certain range
IScore This interface represents the user's Score
IScoreManager This interface represents the class that is responible for keeping score and creating score related events
ISettings This interface represents a class that is responsible for storing the user's current preference settings
ISettingsManager This interface represents a class that is responsible for storing the user's current preference settings and creating settings related events
ISoundEngine This interface provides the service of actually playing sounds
ISoundEngineVisitor This Visitor allows the answer to call a method of the ISoundengine appropriate for its internal structure.
 

Class Summary
AdvancedChords This class is an Excercise that works with more sophisticated types of 4 and 5 note chords
AnswerManager Handles the storage and management of a set of possible answers that a user is working with at any given time.
AnswerStrategySetter This class handles changing the IAnswer's guessStrategy when it is sellected so that it knows that it is the correct answer
BasicAnswer The BasicAnswer class models any answer that can be viewed as a two dimensional array of integers (MIDI values).
BasicChords This class is an Excercise that works with the 4 basic triads and the 5 most common 7th chords
BasicScales This IExcercise tests recognition of Basic Scales, including all of the modes of the major scale and the two additional forms of the minor scale
ExampleManager The example manager controls the portion of the system that handles all example-related activities such as playing, repeating, enabling, and disabling answers.
ExcerciseManager this class is responsible for handling excercise related events in the system such as changing to a different excercise
Intervals This IExcercise tests the basic 2-note intervals up to one octave
MainFrame_AboutBox Title: SmartEars Description: An ear Training program.
MidiSoundEngine This class generates sounds based on arrays of ints using java's MIDI capabilities in the javax.sound.midi package
RandomStrategy This startegy chooses randomly amongst the set of answers.
RangeManager This class manages the user-defined range of pitches that sounds should be played in
ScoreManager This class is responsible for storing the user's score statistics and creating Score related events
SettingsManager This class is repsonible for storing the user's current preference settings
SmartEars This class serves as a Controller for this application in that it connects the model classes with the view classes.
Trichords This IExcercise tests recognition of Trichords, which are three note groupings distinguished by their intervalic content.
 

Exception Summary
NoPossibleAnswersException Thrown to indicate that there are no answers eligible for selection, and at least one must be added to the IAnswerManager
RangeException This class of Exception indicates a problem with the range of something
